com.percussion.utils.timing
Class PSStopwatchStack

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.utils.timing.PSStopwatchStack

public class PSStopwatchStack
extends Object

Stopwatch handler that creates stopwatches on a thread-based stack. This allows handlers to push and pop the timers on the stack. As timers are pushed onto the stack, they are paused. As they are popped to the top of the stack they are restarted.

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

getStack

public static PSStopwatchStack getStack()
Factory method to get the stopwatch stack. Threadsafe through the use of ThreadLocal.

Returns:
the current thread's instance of the stopwatch stack

start

public void start(String category)
Start the stopwatch. If there's a current stopwatch being measured, then pause it.

Parameters:
category - category used for recording statistics, must not be null or empty

start

public void start(String category,
                  PSStopwatch watch)
Start a stopwatch and add to the stack. If there's a current stopwatch being measured, then pause it.

Parameters:
category - the category, never null or empty
watch - the stopwatch, never null

current

public PSStopwatch current()
Peek at the current stopwatch

Returns:
the current top stopwatch or null if the stack is empty

stop

public PSStopwatch stop()
Stop the top stopwatch and return it. If there are more stopwatches on the stack then continue the next stopwatch.

Returns:
the top stopwatch, never null. Throws an exception if the stack is exhausted.

getStats

public String getStats()
Print out known statistics at this point

Returns:
the statistics, formatted as a series of category=value pairs

finish

public void finish()
Check the stack for completeness and print the statistics. If there are lingering stopwatches on the stack, print warnings and stop them.

profile

public Object profile(org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint call)
               throws Throwable
Throws:
Throwable
